title: Why am I getting so many phone scam calls? How did they even get my phone number? - Quora

response.answer_text: You gave out your number as soon as you installed apps. read their tos and privacy, you will see many want your number and will share it with 3rd parties. . You signed up to a newspaper or club, maybe even your fav restaurant … they got your number, and so will everyone else. . You called your carrier for an upgrade …. this is legally tricky, the service center may infact be a company contracted by your carrier, they have their own tos and privacy (hidden from public) because when you search your carrier, you get ‘your carrier’ you dont get the contracted company…. they have a 1 2 3 agreement policy which does not require your written approval and works like this: 1 you called them 2 you requested a service from them 3 you completed the call to them once you pass all 3 of these, you are then legally allowing this company to do whatever they want with your number. (this was on a docu about cold calling centers and how they get peoples details and are legally allowed to share/sell that information). . Your friend or a random person used your number to fill in a competition form, they dont want spam, but they have no issues putting down a fake number which isnt theirs. . There are other ways, but these are the most common.

Whenever you download an app from the store and you first open it, it asks for your permission to read your contacts, photos and other stuff, that gives access to nearly everything on your phone. That data is sold to certain companies (their primary source of income), and Voila - you get those unwanted calls! How else did you think apps could be offered for free, how’d the developer earn - That’s How!

It’s my opinion that in many cases the systems generating these scam calls simply automatically dials every number in sequence- until it gets one that’s answered (or goes to voicemail). It’s not that someone “has your number.” It’s just random. These systems call everyone. There’s no way to hide :-(
